title: UpToDate
description_en: UpToDate is a web application I developed for myself to manage my appointments, notes and lists. The application contains a calendar, a program to create notes, a todo list and many other small functions that help me to structure my thoughts. The idea came from the fact that many apps I used simply had too many functions and could not be used on all operating systems. Furthermore, I now have the possibility to use the developed REST API to integrate my appointments and notes in my smarthome, for example by displaying my calendar on the TVs. I use the application almost every day to enter my appointments, structure my ideas and keep track of my tasks. The application is written with the backend framework Spring Boots based on the Java programming language and in the frontend the Angular framework is utilized.
description_de: UpToDate is a web application I developed for myself to manage my appointments, notes and lists. The application contains a calendar, a program to create notes, a todo list and many other small functions that help me to structure my thoughts. The idea came from the fact that many apps I used simply had too many functions and could not be used on all operating systems. Furthermore, I now have the possibility to use the developed REST API to integrate my appointments and notes in my smarthome, for example by displaying my calendar on the TVs. I use the application almost every day to enter my appointments, structure my ideas and keep track of my tasks. The application is written with the backend framework Spring Boots based on the Java programming language and in the frontend the Angular framework is utilized.

title: Compiler Construction with Flex, Yacc, Ox and iBurg
description_en: This repository contains my first self-written programming language, which I developed during the course compiler development at the Vienna University of Technology. The lexical analysis is based on the tool Flex. The parser was developed with the help of YACC. The described grammar was attributed with the assistance of OX. Finally, a tree grammar was created with the help of OX and iBurg, which can be used to generate Assembler 64 code.
description_de: This repository contains my first self-written programming language, which I developed during the course compiler development at the Vienna University of Technology. The lexical analysis is based on the tool Flex. The parser was developed with the help of YACC. The described grammar was attributed with the assistance of OX. Finally, a tree grammar was created with the help of OX and iBurg, which can be used to generate Assembler 64 code.

title: Visual Computing
description_en: This repository contains assignments that should be developed in the course Introduction to Visual Computing at the Vienna University of Technology. Most of the tasks are written in Matlab and cover Topics of visual computing. The other part of the tasks are modelings that were created with Blender.
description_de: This repository contains assignments that should be developed in the course Introduction to Visual Computing at the Vienna University of Technology. Most of the tasks are written in Matlab and cover Topics of visual computing. The other part of the tasks are modelings that were created with Blender.

title: Statistical Computing With R
description_en: This repository contains exercises that were required in the course Statistical Computing in R at the Vienna University of Technology. In total, four examples were worked on, all of which were developed using the programming language R.

title: Web Engineering
description_en: This repository contains assignments to be completed in the course of the Web Engineering course at the Vienna University of Technology. The first example deals with web page design using CSS. In the second example plain JavaScript was used. In the third example the backend of a web application was written with Node.js. In the last example the frontend of the web application was developed with Vue.js.

In the last example the frontend of the web application was developed with Vue.js.

title: Distributed Systems In Java
description_en: This repository contains the exercises that we had to complete as a team to finish the distributed systems course at the Vienna University of Technology. Both exercises are written in Java and retain concepts such as threads, synchronization and parallelization.
description_de: This repository contains the exercises that we had to complete as a team to finish the distributed systems course at the Vienna University of Technology. Both exercises are written in Java and retain concepts such as threads, synchronization and parallelization.

title: Smart Driving - Driving Log Application
description_en: Smart Driving is the first iOS app I wrote with Swift and Firebase. The goal of the application was to automatically read position data from a car's GPS device and automatically create a driving log for corporate clients. Unfortunately the application could not be used in practice according to Austrian law.
description_de: Smart Driving is the first iOS app I wrote with Swift and Firebase. The goal of the application was to automatically read position data from a car's GPS device and automatically create a driving log for corporate clients. Unfortunately the application could not be used in practice according to Austrian law.

title: LinkHype - Hyperlink Management
description_en: LinkHype is a website we developed as a team at the Rennweg Higher Technical School. The website is written in PHP and Javascript and is the first major website with functionality that my team and I have developed. The goal of the website is to store and manage hyperlinks.
description_de: LinkHype is a website we developed as a team at the Rennweg Higher Technical School. The website is written in PHP and Javascript and is the first major website with functionality that my team and I have developed. The goal of the website is to store and manage hyperlinks.

title: Functional Programming in Haskell

title: Ticketline - Software Engineering Project
description_en: This repository contains a ticket store for events that we had to develop as a team in the scope of the course Software Development and Project Management at the Vienna University of Technology. The backend is written with the framework Spring Boot based on Java. The frontend uses the framework Angular. The goal of the project was to plan and finally implement a complete software project as a team.

The backend is written with the framework Spring Boot based on Java. The frontend uses the framework Angular. The goal of the project was to plan and finally implement a complete software project as a team.

title: Vacayournal - Vacation + Journal
description_en: In this repository you can find a clone of Instagram and Facebook that I developed in the summer of 2019. The application was written in PHP and JavaScript without frameworks. The goal of the application was to develop a platform independent of Facebook (Meta) on which pictures and posts can be shared with friends. The goal of the development was to further my education in web development and website design.
